description: After applying the updates KB5044285, KB5044284, KB5044280, and KB5044273 for various Windows versions and builds, users may experience unexpected behaviors. These could include system instability, applications crashing, or failure to recognize network interfaces correctly. In particular, users on Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems (10.0.19045.5011) and Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems (10.0.22621.4317) may report intermittent network connectivity issues, leading to disruptions in remote access capabilities. The impact on systems could vary according to different hardware configurations but is predominantly noted in devices relying on the Windows Mobile Broadband driver, which may affect users' ability to maintain stable connections post-update. Therefore, system administrators should monitor end-user feedback closely to address these potential impacts efficiently.
